about_the_game:
Story Overview: 2046. World War III has ended, tearing superpowers into small nation-states. Somewhere in the middle of Asia, rich and powerful came together to make their own. You were born there, right at the bottom.

Confined by serial killer parents, you spent seven years in a basement with no contact with the outside world. When they were arrested, you were moved to the institution, where you befriended four girls and one boy. The most bullied children.

Your group planned to leave the facility as soon as all of you turned legal age, and requested a transfer to the university. On your long-anticipated day of release, Saya, one of your friends, committed suicide...



  • Post-War Setting: fragmented nation-state post-WWIII.
  • Dark Beginnings: explore the trauma of people closest to you and find ways to overcome it.
  • Unique Companions: Four friends and a teacher, each with a mysterious and troubled past.
  • Non-Linear Storytelling: Choices carve unique paths through a branching narrative.
  • Deep Character Routes: Five main heroine routes with good and evil endings. Additional sub-routes for supporting characters and extra endings.
  • Complex Morality: Paths including heroism, villainy, and beyond.
  • Dynamic Relationships: Romance, domination, friendship, or solitude?

content_descriptors.notes:
The game includes fictional depictions of suicide, bullying, discrimination, abuse, emotional trauma, psychological disorders, sexual assault (between adults, non-explicit), and alcohol abuse. Your choices will either lead you deep into the mature content during the evil playthroughs, or to their reduction as you help those around you.

The game is set in a future fictional world, post-WWIII. The characters can either succeed in overcoming their trauma (good endings) or fail and dive deeper into extreme end of their trauma (bad endings).

There are no visual depictions of extreme violence or gore (such as high amounts of blood or bones), and the mature subjects are depicted in a non-extreme and non-glorifying way as a storytelling device. The game includes the topics and mentions of death.

The sexual content is non-explicit and presented through textual descriptions with imagery, or story implications. There are no explicit sex scenes, outside of what would be expected of a vanilla dating simulation such as dating, kissing, stimulating scenes and light touching.

Depending on the selected playthrough, the intensity of the content will vary from vanilla (hero-type) content with a lower frequency of violence and corruption behaviors, to the evil playthrough with higher levels of harm, substance abuse, and morally corrupt behavior.

short_description: 2046, post-WWIII nation. You spent your childhood locked in the basement. After the rescue, you ended up at the Institution for Abused Children and befriended its outcasts. A day before leaving, your friend committed suicide... Why are you still able to see her?
